title.rendered: Willyrex against the world for NFTs: “It makes me want to vomit in your face”

content.rendered:
The supposed volatility of the world of NFTs and cryptocurrencies is taking its toll on the streamer landscape, which has seen Willyrex launch its own non-fungible tokens in mid-November 2021. The replies were not long in coming in the voice of protagonists in favor of a presentation like the one made by the Spanish youtuber.

The week started convulsively with some statements by Willyrex on social networks, in which he was surprised by the inaction of others regarding NFTs, with a certain aroma of provocation: “Everyone who laughs at NFTs please don’t delete the tweets we will all laugh at one time. I don’t know how you can be so short-mindedwhen everyone is yelling it.”

Felipez, very harsh in his criticism of Willyrex’s NFTs

Willyrex ironized on his Twitter profile on the topic of fashion: “It’s all a scam… just like buying online when your card was stolen.” His posts on social networks have been seen by several of his counterparts as mere provocations and some streamers have ended up answering him in one way or another.as is the case with Alexelcapo, Eric Lostie, Polo, JWulen, Felipez or Yuste.

Especially hard has been Felipez360, who never cuts a hair when expressing his opinion on the current situation surrounding the panorama. This time, he has given one of lime and one of sand. “I don’t doubt that technology is interesting. That in 20 or 30 years it will stabilize in something beyond pure speculation because I can buy it from you,” he began by admitting.

“Now then, what someone who passively generates hundreds or thousands of euros a day told them about the benefits of something as volatile and dangerous as this to an audience as exposed and as massive as the one you haveIt makes me want not to vomit, but to vomit in your face. But that’s my opinion,” Felipez concluded, citing Willyrex’s own tweet.

Along the same lines was Yuste, the Twitch morning man par excellence: “NFTs are not a scam. The way you offer it to your audience is only. The idea of ​​clearly identifying the owner of a digital work or object is interesting and not a scam. The ‘BUY NFTS DON’T BE A FOOL YOU WILL GET A LOT OF PROFITABILITY YOU WILL BE RICH 100% REAL DO NOT FAKE IF YOU BUY MY NFT’s is a scam”.

Alexelcapo: “All the incredible benefits they say they have are only focused on making money”

Alexelcapo has also wanted to go public to answer the controversy of Willyrex and cryptocurrencies, assuming that “the problem is not the NFT concept”. “The problem is that of all the incredible benefits that they say they have, they only focus on one, making money. And yes, 99% of games (100% at the moment) are fucking shit, but they upload them anyway because you come here to make money”.

Eric Lostie pulls newspaper library to comment on NFTs

Streamers have come out of all the communities to answer Willyrex, with the most varied opinions. Eric Lostie, creator of Pokémon fan-games, has used the Spanish streamer’s own words against him: “I tried to inform myself with your own videos and when you said ‘downloading an NFT image is like taking a picture in front of a house and saying it’s yours’, I decided that I would never stop finding this ridiculous”.

Memes everywhere about Willyrex NFTs

There are always consequences. And more when in the eye of the hurricane is a high-caliber youtuber. Willyrex is and therefore the queue of the NFTs topic will be long and constant. The controversy has attracted a tweeting public that is always on the alert, basing its content on ‘shitposting’. Social networks have been plagued with memes with the image of the youtuber’s non-fungible token.
